title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement nicolas.casajus@fondationbiodiversite.fr. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to rdeps
text: First , thanks taking time contribute rdeps! types contributions encouraged valued. See Table contents different ways help details project handles . Please make sure read relevant section making contribution. make lot easier us maintainers smooth experience involved.

text: Code conduct Style guide Commit messages Asking questions Reporting bugs Requesting features Contributing code

title: Contributing to rdeps
text: project released Contributor Code Conduct. participating, expected uphold code. Please report unacceptable behavior nicolas.casajus@fondationbiodiversite.fr.

title: Contributing to rdeps
text: use Tidyverse style guide writing R code. Functions documented roxygen2 syntax. rdeps uses lower_snake_case.

title: Contributing to rdeps
text: want contribute commiting changes, please try use Conventional commits specification.

title: Contributing to rdeps
text: ask question, best search existing Issues might help . case found suitable issue still need clarification, can write question issue. still feel need ask question need clarification, recommend following: Open new Issue. Use template other_issue.md. Provide much context can ’re running . Provide project platform versions (paste output sessionInfo()). take care issue soon possible.

title: Contributing to rdeps
text: good bug report shouldn’t leave others needing chase information. Therefore, ask investigate carefully, collect information describe issue detail report. Please complete following steps advance help us fix potential bug fast possible. Make sure using latest version rdeps. Determine bug really bug error side. see users experienced (potentially already solved) issue , check already bug report existing bug error bug tracker.

what: How do I submit a bug report?
title: Contributing to rdeps
text: use GitHub Issues track bugs errors. run issue project: Open new Issue. Use template bug_report.md. Explain behavior expect actual behavior. Please provide much context possible describe reproduction steps someone else can follow recreate issue . usually includes code reproducible example. take care issue soon possible.

title: Contributing to rdeps
text: Make sure using latest version rdeps. Read documentation carefully find functionality already covered. Perform search see enhancement already suggested. , add comment existing issue instead opening new one.

what: How do I submit a feature request?
title: Contributing to rdeps
text: Feature requests tracked GitHub Issues. Open new Issue. Use template feature_request.md. Provide clear descriptive title issue identify suggestion. Provide step--step description suggested enhancement many details possible. Explain enhancement useful rdeps users. take care issue soon possible.

title: Contributing to rdeps
text: use GitHub flow collaborate project: Fork repository using GitHub interface. Clone fork using git clone fork-url (replace fork-url URL fork). Alternatively, open RStudio IDE create New Project Version Control. Create new branch w/ git checkout -b branch-name (replace branch-name name new branch). Make contribution (see examples). Stage (git add) commit (git commit) changes often necessary Push changes GitHub w/ git push origin branch-name. Submit Pull Request original repo. review PR soon possible.

title: Contributing to rdeps
text: want contribute improving README, please edit README.Rmd (README.md). forget update README.md running:

title: Contributing to rdeps
text: want contribute editing existing vignette, just edit corresponding Rmd file stored vignettes/ folder. want contribute adding new vignette, create new Rmd file vignettes/ folder add following header: use new external dependency, forget add DESCRIPTION file section Suggests (package already listed section Imports). Check integrity package :
code: --- title: "Vignette Title" output: rmarkdown::html_vignette vignette: >   %\VignetteIndexEntry{Vignette Title}   %\VignetteEngine{knitr::rmarkdown}   %\VignetteEncoding{UTF-8} --- devtools::check()

title: Contributing to rdeps
text: want contribute improving documentation function, open corresponding file R/ folder edit lines starting #' (roxygen2 syntax). Update documentation (Rd files man/ folder) running: use new external dependency example section, forget add DESCRIPTION file section Imports (package already listed). Check integrity package :

title: Contributing to rdeps
text: want contribute improving code function, open edit corresponding file R/ folder. Check integrity package : forget adapt unit tests function editing corresponding file stored tests/testthat/ folder. use package testthat implement unit tests. Check tests running:

title: Contributing to rdeps
text: want contribute submitting new feature, please follow workflow: Create new R file folder R/. Implement code function. Document function w/ roxygen2 syntax. necessary, add additional dependencies DESCRIPTION file. Update package documentation w/ devtools::document(). Create new R file folder tests/testthat/. Implement unit tests new function. Check integrity package w/ devtools::check(). Thanks contribution!

title: Authors and Citation
text: Nicolas Casajus. Author, maintainer, copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Casajus Nicolas (2023). rdeps: R package identify external packages used project. R package version 0.2, https://github.com/frbcesab/rdeps.
code: @Manual{,   title = {rdeps: {An} {R} package to identify external packages used in a project},   author = {{Casajus Nicolas}},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.2},   url = {https://github.com/frbcesab/rdeps}, }

what: Identify External Packages Used in a Project
title: Identify External Packages Used in a Project
text: • Overview • Features • Installation • Get started • Citation • Contributing

title: Identify External Packages Used in a Project
text: goal R package rdeps provide tool identify external packages used project (package, compendium, website, etc.) list DESCRIPTION file.

title: Identify External Packages Used in a Project
text: rdeps screens .R, .Rmd, .qmd files extract name packages used project. package detects packages called library(foo), require(foo), foo::bar() adds dependencies DESCRIPTION file sections Depends, Imports, Suggests. Different types dependencies handled: package called library(foo) require(foo), added section Depends DESCRIPTION file (except vignettes tests); package called foo::bar(), added section Imports DESCRIPTION file (except vignettes tests); package used vignettes tests, added section Suggests DESCRIPTION file.

title: Identify External Packages Used in a Project
text: can install stable version CRAN : can install development version GitHub : can attach package rdeps:
code: ## Install stable version of < rdeps > from CRAN ---- install.packages("rdeps") ## Install < remotes > package (if not already installed) ---- if (!requireNamespace("remotes", quietly = TRUE)) {   install.packages("remotes") }  ## Install < rdeps > from GitHub ---- remotes::install_github("frbcesab/rdeps") library("rdeps")

title: Identify External Packages Used in a Project
text: rdeps contains one main function: add_deps(). Note: project must contain DESCRIPTION file. DESCRIPTION file can created added existing project function usethis::use_description().

title: Identify External Packages Used in a Project
text: Please cite rdeps : Casajus Nicolas (2024) rdeps: R package identify external packages used project. R package version 0.2, https://github.com/frbcesab/rdeps/.

title: Identify External Packages Used in a Project
text: types contributions encouraged valued. information, check Contributor Guidelines. Please note rdeps project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

what: Add required dependencies to the description file — add_deps
title: Add required dependencies to the description file — add_deps
text: function detects external packages used R project (package, compendium, website, etc.) updates sections Depends, Imports, Suggests DESCRIPTION file. DESCRIPTION file can created added existing project function use_description() package usethis. .R, .Rmd, .qmd files screened identify packages called library(foo), library("foo"), library('foo'), require(foo), require("foo"), require('foo') foo::bar(). Different types dependencies handled following rules: package called library(foo) require(foo), added section Depends DESCRIPTION file (except vignettes tests); package called foo::bar(), added section Imports DESCRIPTION file (except vignettes tests); package used vignettes tests, added section Suggests DESCRIPTION file. function also screens NAMESPACE file (detects packages mentioned import(foo) importFrom(foo,bar)) @examples sections roxygen2 headers. detected packages added Imports section DESCRIPTION file. project R package, non-standard folders also screened (.e. analyses/, paper/, etc.). detected packages added Imports section DESCRIPTION file.

title: Add required dependencies to the description file — add_deps
Add required dependencies to the description file — add_deps
text: return value.

title: Add required dependencies to the description file — add_deps

what: rdeps: Identify External Packages Used in a Project — rdeps-package
title: rdeps: Identify External Packages Used in a Project — rdeps-package
text: Screens '.R', '.Rmd', '.qmd' files extract name packages used project. package detects packages called 'library(foo)', 'require(foo)', 'foo::bar()' adds dependencies DESCRIPTION file sections Depends, Imports, Suggests.

title: rdeps: Identify External Packages Used in a Project — rdeps-package
text: Maintainer: Nicolas Casajus nicolas.casajus@fondationbiodiversite.fr (ORCID) [copyright holder]
